tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE environmental_data (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT,
    location VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_location VARCHAR(255),
    recorded_at TIMESTAMP,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE climate_data (
    data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_id INT,
    recorded_at TIMESTAMP,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT,
    pressure FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE location (
    location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    city VARCHAR(255),
    country VARCHAR(255),
    latitude FLOAT,
    longitude FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE sensors (sensor_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
 sensor_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
 location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
 sensor_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
 installation_date DATE);

CREATE TABLE sensor_readings (reading_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
 sensor_id UUID REFERENCES sensors(sensor_id),
 reading_value FLOAT NOT NULL,
 reading_timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL);

CREATE TABLE sensor_alerts (alert_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
 sensor_id UUID REFERENCES sensors(sensor_id),
 alert_message TEXT NOT NULL,
 alert_timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL);

CREATE TABLE sensor_metadata (sensor_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
 manufacturer VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
 model VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
 firmware_version VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
 calibration_date DATE);

CREATE TABLE sensor_locations (
  sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE sensor_readings (
  reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  reading_value FLOAT,
  reading_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES sensor_locations(sensor_id)
)

CREATE TABLE temperature_readings (
  temperature_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  temperature_value FLOAT,
  reading_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES sensor_locations(sensor_id)
)

CREATE TABLE humidity_readings (
  humidity_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  humidity_value FLOAT,
  reading_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES sensor_locations(sensor_id)
)

CREATE TABLE pressure_readings (
  pressure_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  pressure_value FLOAT,
  reading_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES sensor_locations(sensor_id)
)
